channel.title: Hi
channel.description: Hey guys, I'm new here. This is my first post. I'm active on a couple other forums but came here in need of help. I am trying to code a server just for the experience. Maybe one day it'll be put online. But I'm not a coding master or anywhere near it. I know a lot of basic things from different threads I found when googling something. I need someone that's able to tutor me on how to code. I have looked at different online sources on how to code and I've learned some stuff from them but it's hard for me to learn that way. I learn best with hand on activities. I have a blank 317 source already. I've added a lot of things to it all hand coded, not from tuts or snippets. I look at them to get ideas then try to do it myself from there. I've had help but that person has been busy with his job for about 2 weeks now so I haven't done much since then. I'm available in the mornings (I live in eastern USA; -5:00) and most of the days on the weekends. If you want to help me, pm me your Skype and I'll add you. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @dirtybubble dirtybubble
item.description:
@dirtybubble wrote:

very true. ive been given some more tuts to look over haha. i have a lot of studying to do in my free time lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“dirtybubble, post:8, topic:551496”]very true. i want to learn how to code the server and by looking at the tuts online, it shows only how to code in java (which is great and teaches me a lot about the language) but it doesnt really show how to code java into a game. and thats what i want help with. a tutor or someone to show and teach me how to do that.

sorry sk8r, this is my first post. how do i move it to the correct section? also, i have seen and learned from many java tuts. they all seem to just be coding stuff in a console which is different than in a server.[/quote]
They’re different, but it’s still good to use them. They teach you how to use the different classes of Java and etc. Which you can then apply into your server.

For instance, if you learn how to use the Calendar class then you would be able to apply that knowledge to create something like Automatic double exp weekend’s.

Also, there is no way to move topics without being a staff member of the forums, you can report the topic and when it’s reviewed they will move it to the section that’s most if (If applicable).

Read full topic

sorry sk8r, this is my first post. how do i move it to the correct section? also, i have seen and learned from many java tuts. they all seem to just be coding stuff in a console which is different than in a server.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Hi and welcome to the forums.
It’s recommended you read the overall forum rules posted here
And also the sectional rules posted here.

This section is intended to give people help on a specific error(s) or for them to get help doing something they don’t know how to.

I highly recommend reading java docs and tutorials, as that’s the language RSPS is wrote in. The tutorials wrote by oracle can be found here. Others can be simply found by googling Java tutorials.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

dirtybubble:

i mainly chose 317 bc i like the old rs. im not a fan of the new rs graphics. and i originally learned on a 317. i like the new items bc theyre stronger but i like the old school graphics better. i messaged you shock. I know 317 has a lot more dupes and bugs and stuff but I wanna learn how to find and fix those. I’m just a sucker for old school with the new school weapons and armors lol

It’s all up to you what you choose to start with, no need to justify yourself. And I don’t know what you mean that 317’s have a lot more dupes and bugs? These are factors of how to code was written, of course if the source got written terrible then it ends up like PI having a ton of bugs, but if it’s well written it’s the opposite then, it’d run flawless. Of course, there are always bugs in common. Conclusion: the better you write the code the better will be the stability and the better the maintainability, but there are always bugs. : -)
We can continue talking via PM, I think problem is solved?

Read full topic

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“dirtybubble, post:3, topic:551496”]thanks welliton. I have a blank 317 and plan on sticking with full 317. Im trying to add the new items while still loading the 317 graphics. I have no idea what to do lol. i have some dat files that has the new items and i have the ints and i have the items in my .cfg file but when i go to spawn the items nothing happens.
I have made a lot of mistakes so far lol. i used to copy and paste tuts but all of them gave me a lot of errors i didnt know how to fix and so i started to learn the language. i know most of the basics now. I took a college course in java and found some good youtube videos that teaches it but its hard for me to convert (i guess) everything from what i learned there to the rsps bc everything i learned hasnt been done for a server so one of the first things i found is that to make the program send a message, you have to do System.out.println(""); but for my server i do c.sendMessage("");. theres been a few other things that i found thats different in the server than in the other thing.
I have some knowledge of the language. My hardest thing is learning from videos and books lol. I need that interaction and someone to tell me yes u did it or no thats not right or theres a better way to do it. I have looked at a lot of different tuts on java and i learned a lot of stuff from them but its different to make a game than the tuts ive seen.[/quote]

Hi there,

My advice for you would be that you start off with a base with much content rather than a clean one, since you can always look at the content packed source to see how things are being handled and may re-write it. (I think you mentioned that already).

With re-writing I mean trying to create different code but the same output.

I gotta agree with Welliton, you should start off with a 317 to get used to the protocol. If you’re a fast learner, go for higher revisions between 500 and 742. If it’s the case that you want to go for higher revisions, drop me a message so I can supply you with further information.

PS: Make sure you’re using an IDE.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @dirtybubble dirtybubble
item.description:
@dirtybubble wrote:

thanks welliton. I have a blank 317 and plan on sticking with full 317. Im trying to add the new items while still loading the 317 graphics. I have no idea what to do lol. i have some dat files that has the new items and i have the ints and i have the items in my .cfg file but when i go to spawn the items nothing happens.
I have made a lot of mistakes so far lol. i used to copy and paste tuts but all of them gave me a lot of errors i didnt know how to fix and so i started to learn the language. i know most of the basics now. I took a college course in java and found some good youtube videos that teaches it but its hard for me to convert (i guess) everything from what i learned there to the rsps bc everything i learned hasnt been done for a server so one of the first things i found is that to make the program send a message, you have to do System.out.println(""); but for my server i do c.sendMessage("");. theres been a few other things that i found thats different in the server than in the other thing.
I have some knowledge of the language. My hardest thing is learning from videos and books lol. I need that interaction and someone to tell me yes u did it or no thats not right or theres a better way to do it. I have looked at a lot of different tuts on java and i learned a lot of stuff from them but its different to make a game than the tuts ive seen.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

Java is your tutor. I honestly suggest if you’re new to this, the base that you chosen you play around with it. I also suggest that you stick to a 317 as your starting base.

You will make many mistakes but it is all a learning process. I was like you once, I went straight into RSPS development without any sort of knowledge in Java. I made hundreds of mistakes at my first go, but I learnt so much from these mistakes and it made me want to actually learn what it was I was doing wrong/what the piece of code meant. That is where I decided I wanted to learn about the language of Java.

I wish you the best of luck on your future RSPS development.

Read full topic
